title: Solomon's Wisdom and Wealth
shortSummary: This chapter introduces Solomon's reign as king of Israel, highlighting his request for wisdom from God and the divine response granting him unparalleled wisdom, riches, and honor. It also describes Solomon's preparations for ruling, including his offerings, military strength, and economic prosperity, setting the stage for his renowned leadership.
timeline: c. 970 BC - Beginning of Solomon's reign over Israel

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: Son of David and king of Israel who seeks wisdom to govern God's people and is blessed with wisdom, riches, and honor.

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: Father of Solomon and former king of Israel who prepared the ark's resting place in Jerusalem.

keyCharacters.name: Bezaleel
keyCharacters.description: Artisan, son of Uri and grandson of Hur, who crafted the brazen altar used in Solomon's offerings.

definitions.definition: The portable sanctuary built by Moses in the wilderness where God’s presence dwelt and where Israel worshiped before the temple was built.
A large bronze altar used for burnt offerings, symbolizing atonement and worship before God.
A sacrifice wholly consumed by fire, symbolizing complete dedication and atonement to God.
Strategic cities where Solomon stationed his chariots and horsemen to maintain military strength and security.

outline.heading: Solomon Strengthened and Gathering Leaders
outline.description: Solomon's kingdom is established with God's presence and favor, and he summons Israel's leaders to unite under his reign, demonstrating his authority and the beginning of his rule.

outline.heading: Worship at Gibeon and Offerings
outline.description: Solomon and the congregation worship at the high place in Gibeon, offering a thousand burnt offerings on the brazen altar, showing reverence and dependence on God’s presence.

outline.heading: God’s Appearance and Solomon’s Prayer
outline.description: God appears to Solomon at night, inviting him to ask for whatever he desires; Solomon humbly requests wisdom and knowledge to govern Israel rightly.

outline.heading: God’s Promise of Wisdom and Blessings
outline.description: God grants Solomon wisdom and knowledge and promises him unparalleled riches, wealth, and honor because of his selfless request.

outline.heading: Solomon’s Return and Preparations for Reign
outline.description: Solomon returns to Jerusalem, consolidates his military power with chariots and horsemen, and establishes economic prosperity through trade, demonstrating the practical outworking of God’s blessing.

application: Seek God’s wisdom above worldly wealth or honor, trusting that God will provide what is truly needed for faithful leadership and life decisions.
Approach God with humility and reverence in prayer, acknowledging His sovereignty and your dependence on Him.
Recognize that true blessing comes from God’s favor and obedience to His commands, not merely from human effort or resources.
Use the gifts and resources God provides to serve others and glorify Him, as Solomon did by strengthening his kingdom and people.

keyVerses.text: In that night did God appear unto Solomon, and said unto him, Ask what I shall give thee.
keyVerses.significance: This verse marks the divine invitation for Solomon to seek God's provision, highlighting God's willingness to bless those who seek Him.

keyVerses.text: Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people: for who can judge this thy people, that is so great?
keyVerses.significance: Solomon’s prayer exemplifies a heart focused on godly leadership and responsibility rather than selfish gain.

keyVerses.text: And God said to Solomon, Because this was in thine heart, and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honour, nor the life of thine enemies, neither yet hast asked long life; but hast asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge my people, over whom I have made thee king:
keyVerses.significance: God commends Solomon’s selfless request and reveals the principle that God honors those who prioritize wisdom and righteousness.

keyVerses.text: Wisdom and knowledge is granted unto thee; and I will give thee riches, and wealth, and honour, such as none of the kings have had that have been before thee, neither shall there any after thee have the like.
keyVerses.significance: This verse confirms God’s abundant blessing on Solomon, showing that godly wisdom leads to comprehensive blessing.
